--- In nbwrpg@y..., robertdahl <rdahl@t...> wrote:
> Beachcomber smiled that he was able to help, but then stopped. He 
was
> perplexed by the readings, and not to sure how to help. It seemed 
like
> this robot was emmitting high energy readings. He tried again. "Do 
you
> need repairs?" he asked.

::REDHOT::

    Redhot looked up at the strange robot with tired eyes. He did not 
answer the question at first, instead focusing his foggy mind on the 
energy around him. His eyes hooded with the enormous concentration 
involved. 
    (Old..One...) he pleaded with it. (...pl..ease...leave..) Almost 
immediately the energy dispersed, as if controlled by supernatural 
forces. Or had a mind of it's own.
    Releved that it left, Redhot groaned. He tried to thank it but 
couldn't find the strength. Instead he lazily gazed at the strange 
robot.
    "Re..pair..s....go..od." he croaked. He managed a faint smile. 
Then he closed his eyes and rested.

Northlight
Domnijoe Productions
